intro: Leiothrix marahuacensis, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly glossy appearance. The bark is smooth and grayish, often exuding a sticky resin when damaged.
